abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery and Adjustment
            Credit will support the resumption of sustained growth in
            Togo following the economic and fiscal collapse of 1992-93.
            Its main objectives are to restore macroeconomic stability,
            support a strong private sector-led supply response to the
            devaluation of the CFA franc, and improve the delivery of
            essential social services. The adjustment package under the
            operation supports the restoration of macroeconomic
            stability through: 1) public finance measures to rebuild the
            tax base, contain expenditures and clear arrears; and 2)
            acceleration of the public enterprise liquidation and
            privatization program to eliminate loss-making enterprises
            and shield viable enterprises from pressure to finance
            government deficits. Reforms to support broad-based private
            sector-led growth include: 1) improving the regulatory
            environment through revision of investment and labor codes
            and further price and trade liberalization; and 2)
            increasing the scope for private activity through
            privatization and abolition of remaining public monopolies
            in commercial activities.
